newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Norilsk combine ups Q1 nickel output 11 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Norilsk combine ups Q1 nickel output 11 pct yr/yr.

text.p: The flagship plant of Russia's Norilsk Nickel metals group boosted nickel output by 11 percent during the first three months of 1997 against the same year-ago period, a group spokesman said on Thursday.
Anatoly Komrakov also said that first quarter copper output at the combine rose seven percent year-on-year and cobalt production by four percent. He gave no outright figures.
The plant, the Norilsk mining and metallurgical combine, is part of RAO Norilsky Nikel.
The Norilsk group accounts for about 85 percent of Russia's total nickel production, and the combine accounts for about half the group's output.
Late last month the State Statistics Committee said total Russian nickel output during the first quarter of 1997 had slipped two percent from the same year-ago period.
Komrakov said that the combine had paid its debts fully during the first three months of the year, the first time it had fulfilled a quarterly payment schedule for 18 months.
The combine had also paid its workers according to the schedule agreed between Norilsk management and the strike committee in March.
